image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Texas; born in Washington, D.C., March 8, 1945; graduated from Sulphur Springs High School, Sulphur Springs, Tex., 1963; B.B.A., University of Texas, Austin, Tex., 1968; J.D., Southern Methodist University School of Law, Dallas, Tex., 1970; admitted to the Texas State bar in 1970; lawyer, private practice; district attorney, Eighth Judicial District, 1976-1985; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-ninth Congress by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of United States Representative Sam B. Hall, Jr.; reelected to the five succeeding Congresses (August 3, 1985-January 3, 1997); not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fifth Congress in 1996, but was an unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the United States Senate.

researchRecord.name: 1988-1990, 15 commercials on 3 videocassettes.
researchRecord.description: The commercials were used during Jim Chapman's campaigns for the 1988 and 1990 U.S. congressional elections in District 1 of Texas, Democratic Party.

recordLocation.name: The Julian P. Kanter Political Commercial Archive, Department of Communication

researchRecord.name: 1976-1996, 161 feet.
researchRecord.description: The papers of Jim Chapman include personal, business, congressional papers, and correspondence, containing casework, grants, campaign and district project files, appointment books, congressional scheduling files, photographs, and sound recordings. A finding aid for the papers is available in the repository. Restricted.
